translated: Satva satvasya.

original: aa ti ba la sya /🔽aa pra mo ya ba la sya /🔽badzra se n'a ya sya /🔽badzra k'ama da s+ya /🔽tu ru tu ru /🔽badzra si n'a sv'ah'a /🔽ku ru ku ru ma h'a se n'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽hu ru hu ru; sarba satva /🔽b'u dzi t'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽su ru su ru /🔽satva k'a ma tra ya sv'ah'a /🔽mu ru mu ru /🔽ma h'a pu ru sh'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽ma h'a s'e n'a pa ta ye /🔽sarba karma d'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽sarba dza @254b ya dza ya d'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽sarba siddhi siddhi d'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽sarba d'a na d'a ni n+ya pra d'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽badzra se n'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽aa pra me ya kun ya sv'ah'a /🔽sarba ba ti satva b'u dzi t'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽pra ni grihna m'am raksha m'am sarba k'a ma da /
analyzed: aa ti ba la sya / aa pra mo ya ba la sya / badzra se n'a ya sya / badzra k'ama da s+ya / tu ru tu ru / badzra si n'a sv'ah'a / ku ru ku ru ma h'a se n'a ya sv'ah'a / hu ru hu ru; sarba satva / b'u dzi t'a ya sv'ah'a / su ru su ru / satva k'a ma tra ya sv'ah'a / mu ru mu ru / ma h'a pu ru sh'a ya sv'ah'a / ma h'a s'e n'a pa ta ye / sarba karma d'a ya sv'ah'a / sarba dza @254b ya dza ya d'a ya sv'ah'a / sarba siddhi siddhi d'a ya sv'ah'a / sarba d'a na d'a ni n+ya pra d'a ya sv'ah'a / badzra se n'a ya sv'ah'a / aa pra me ya kun ya sv'ah'a / sarba ba ti satva b'u dzi t'a ya sv'ah'a / pra ni grihna m'am raksha m'am sarba k'a ma da /
translated: Atisayā🔽Apramāṇā🔽Vajrasenā🔽Vajrakāmadhātu🔽Tururu🔽Vajrasenā svāhā🔽Kurukuru mahāsenā svāhā🔽Huruhuru🔽Sarvasatvā🔽Vūjitā svāhā🔽Surusuru🔽Satvakāmatrā svāhā🔽Murumuru🔽Mahāpuruṣāya svāhā🔽Mahāsena-pātaya🔽Sarvakarmadāyaya svāhā🔽Sarvajayajayadāyaya svāhā🔽Sarvasiddhisiddhadāyaya svāhā🔽Sarvadānadāninapradāyaya svāhā🔽Vajrasenāya svāhā🔽Aprameyakuṇḍāya svāhā🔽Sarvabati-satvabūjitāya svāhā🔽Pranigṛhṇa māṃ rakṣa māṃ sarvakāmadā🔽

original: sarba k'a ma ma me p'u r'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽'di yi cho ga bshad par bya //
analyzed: sarba k'a ma ma me p'u r'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽'di yi cho ga bshad par bya //
translated: sarvakāmamane pūrāya svāhā.🔽The ritual of this mantra will be explained.🔽

original: ngas bshad de ni mnyan par gyis //🔽cho ga bzhin du rdo rje sde //
analyzed: ngas bshad de ni mnyan par gyis // cho ga bzhin du rdo rje sde //
translated: Listen to what I say!🔽In accordance with the rite,

original: ri mo'i gzugs ni rgyas byas nas //
analyzed: ri mo'i gzugs ni rgyas byas nas //
translated: having drawn the painting of Vajrasena,

original: bdug pa'i mchod pas mchod bya zhing //
analyzed: bdug pa'i mchod pas mchod bya zhing //
translated: one should worship it with incense

original: bsgrims te rtag tu bzlas brjod bya //🔽sku gdung ldan pa'i mchod rten nam //
analyzed: bsgrims te rtag tu bzlas brjod bya // sku gdung ldan pa'i mchod rten nam //
translated: and always recite the mantra with concentration.🔽In a stūpa that contains relics

original: gang na sku gdung yod pa der //
analyzed: gang na sku gdung yod pa der //
translated: or wherever there are relics,

original: ci nus kyis ni rab bsgrims te //
analyzed: ci nus kyis ni rab bsgrims te //
translated: one should exert oneself as much as possible

original: sngar ni bsnyen pa 'di dag bya //
analyzed: sngar ni bsnyen pa 'di dag bya //
translated: and perform these preliminary practices.

original: de nas zla phyed yang na gcig /
analyzed: de nas zla phyed yang na gcig /
translated: Then, for a fortnight, or a month,

original: yang na zhag ni bdun yang rung //
analyzed: yang na zhag ni bdun yang rung //
translated: or even seven days,

original: dus gsum khrus byas dkar gsum bza'//
analyzed: dus gsum khrus byas dkar gsum bza'//
translated: one should bathe three times a day and eat the three white foods,

original: mnyam bzhag rtag tu bzlas brjod bya //
analyzed: mnyam bzhag rtag tu bzlas brjod bya //
translated: and always recite the mantra in equipoise.

original: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad ldan pas //
analyzed: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad ldan pas //
translated: With the eight branches of purification and restraint,

original: nas kyi kha zas dus gsum bza'//🔽shin tu mnyam bzhag dus gsum du //
analyzed: nas kyi kha zas dus gsum bza'// shin tu mnyam bzhag dus gsum du //
translated: one should eat barley food three times a day.🔽Always in equipoise,

original: brgya rtsa brgyad ni bzlas brjod bya //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad ni bzlas brjod bya //
translated: one should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times three times a day.

original: der ni mar gyi mar me gnyis //
analyzed: der ni mar gyi mar me gnyis //
translated: There, two butter lamps

original: ma shi bar ni gzhag par bya //
analyzed: ma shi bar ni gzhag par bya //
translated: should be placed without going out.

original: phyi nang bzhag ba'i smyung ba bya //
analyzed: phyi nang bzhag ba'i smyung ba bya //
translated: One should observe the external and internal fasts.

original: zla ba nya la rab bsgrims te //
analyzed: zla ba nya la rab bsgrims te //
translated: On the full moon, having exerted oneself,

original: bza' dang btung ba mang po yis //🔽lha bshos mnyam par bzhag pas dbul //
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba mang po yis // lha bshos mnyam par bzhag pas dbul //
translated: with many foods and drinks,🔽one should offer a bali with a focused mind.

original: cho ga dam pas bsrung bya zhing //
analyzed: cho ga dam pas bsrung bya zhing //
translated: One should be protected by the supreme ritual,🔽and having performed

original: cho ga brtan pa des @255a *//
analyzed: cho ga brtan pa des @255a *//
translated: the rite with a firm mind,

original: byas nas // rdo rje sde ni stobs po che //
analyzed: byas nas // rdo rje sde ni stobs po che //
translated: the vajra army, the great powerful one,

original: lan grangs brgya stong bzlas brjod bya //
analyzed: lan grangs brgya stong bzlas brjod bya //
translated: should recite the mantra a hundred thousand times.

original: de nas stobs chen rdo rje sde //
analyzed: de nas stobs chen rdo rje sde //
translated: Then the great powerful vajra army

original: de la yang ni 'grub 'gyur te //🔽yid la ci dang ci 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: de la yang ni 'grub 'gyur te // yid la ci dang ci 'dod pa'i //
translated: will be accomplished for him,🔽and he will accomplish

original: don rnams thams cad byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: don rnams thams cad byed par 'gyur //
translated: all the aims he desires.

original: nad kun yang ni sel byed cing //
analyzed: nad kun yang ni sel byed cing //
translated: He will remove all illnesses

original: 'dod pa thams cad sbyin par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad sbyin par byed //
translated: and grant all wishes.🔽White mustard seed, rice, salt,🔽śvetāli, priyaṅgu, and śigru,

original: yungs kar nas dang lan tshva dang // shu ti dang ni nye'u shing dang // pri yang ku dang shu dag rnams //
analyzed: yungs kar nas dang lan tshva dang // shu ti dang ni nye'u shing dang // pri yang ku dang shu dag rnams //
translated: one should offer into the fire

original: mnyam par bzhag pas zhag bdun du //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pas zhag bdun du //
translated: for seven days with a focused mind.

original: seng ldeng mdag ma dung med la //
analyzed: seng ldeng mdag ma dung med la //
translated: In the ashes of khadira wood

original: de yi ming smos sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: de yi ming smos sbyin sreg bya //
translated: one should offer oblations with his name.

original: zhag bdun bar du lan gcig ni //
analyzed: zhag bdun bar du lan gcig ni //
translated: For seven days, once a day,

original: dus gsum du ni brgya rtsa brgyad //
analyzed: dus gsum du ni brgya rtsa brgyad //
translated: One should perform the homa one hundred and eight times in each of the three periods of time.

original: sbyin sreg rab tu legs byas na //
analyzed: sbyin sreg rab tu legs byas na //
translated: Having performed the homa well,

original: skal chung gis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: skal chung gis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: even one of little fortune will be successful.

original: tshul 'dis sbyin sreg byas na ni //
analyzed: tshul 'dis sbyin sreg byas na ni //
translated: If one performs the homa in this way,

original: sems can kun kyang 'khrug par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can kun kyang 'khrug par 'gyur //
translated: all beings will be agitated.

original: don gang yid la bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: don gang yid la bzhag nas ni //
translated: Whatever purpose one has in mind,🔽if one accomplishes this powerful [rite],

original: stobs chen 'di ni sgrub byas na; ;de yi las de byed 'gyur te //
analyzed: stobs chen 'di ni sgrub byas na; ;de yi las de byed 'gyur te //
translated: that action will be done;

original: 'di la dpyad par bya ba med //
analyzed: 'di la dpyad par bya ba med //
translated: there is no need to analyze this.

original: cho ga gzhan yang rtag tu yid la lan gsum bzlas brjod byas te srung ba yang lan gsum bzlas brjod byas nas gang 'dod pa de bslangs na thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan yang rtag tu yid la lan gsum bzlas brjod byas te srung ba yang lan gsum bzlas brjod byas nas gang 'dod pa de bslangs na thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should always keep in mind another rite: having recited the mantra three times, one should protect oneself, and having recited the mantra three times, one should request whatever one desires.

original: 'dod pa thams cad brjod pas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad brjod pas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: One will accomplish all desires by reciting this.🔽This is its root accomplishment.

original: 'di ni / de'i rtsa ba'i sgrub pa yin @255b no; ;zhag gsum smyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de'i rtsa ba'i sgrub pa yin @255b no; ;zhag gsum smyung bar bya ste /
translated: One should fast for three days.

original: yar gyi ngo tshes bcu gsum la mchod rten gyi drung du ba ser mo'i lci ba las gnod sbyin gyi gzugs byas la /
analyzed: yar gyi ngo tshes bcu gsum la mchod rten gyi drung du ba ser mo'i lci ba las gnod sbyin gyi gzugs byas la /
translated: On the waxing thirteenth, in front of a stūpa, one should make an image of a yakṣa out of cow dung.

original: sna ma'i me tog gi phreng ba phyogs bzhir spyan drangs nas gnod sbyin gyi gtor ma dang / tsandan dkar po dang / k'a ra b'i ra dmar po dang / rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag gis kyang sku gzugs mchod par byas la /
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog gi phreng ba phyogs bzhir spyan drangs nas gnod sbyin gyi gtor ma dang / tsandan dkar po dang / k'a ra b'i ra dmar po dang / rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag gis kyang sku gzugs mchod par byas la /
translated: Having invited the garland of jasmine flowers in the four directions, one should worship the image with the yakṣa bali, white sandalwood, red karavīra, and other various things.

original: gu gul dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ska'i bdug pa sreg shing /
analyzed: gu gul dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ska'i bdug pa sreg shing /
translated: One should burn incense of gugul, agaru, and durvā grass.

original: mar me dang / dri dang / me tog gi phreng bas mchod pa rgyas par byas nas dus gsum du lan brgya rtsa brgyas bzlas brjod byas la /🔽yar gyi ngo tshes gcig la brtsams te tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'am /
analyzed: mar me dang / dri dang / me tog gi phreng bas mchod pa rgyas par byas nas dus gsum du lan brgya rtsa brgyas bzlas brjod byas la / yar gyi ngo tshes gcig la brtsams te tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'am /
translated: Having made extensive offerings with lamps, scents, and flower garlands, one should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times in the three periods of the day.🔽Beginning on the first day of the waxing phase, one should recite the mantra countless times in the three periods of the day until the eighth, fourteenth, or fifteenth day.

original: nya'i bar du dus gsum du grangs med par bzlas brjod byas na don grub par byed /
analyzed: nya'i bar du dus gsum du grangs med par bzlas brjod byas na don grub par byed /
translated: If one does so, one will accomplish one's aims.

original: rdo rje sde'i snying po rdzogs so ////🔽na mo buddhe bhya:ma h'a p'u tsu sha ka bhe bhyo //
analyzed: rdo rje sde'i snying po rdzogs so //// na mo buddhe bhya:ma h'a p'u tsu sha ka bhe bhyo //
translated: The essence of Vajra-Garuḍa is complete.🔽Homage to the Buddha, the great, the glorious, the divine!

original: na ma:sarba lo ka pa bha bishnu ba /
analyzed: na ma:sarba lo ka pa bha bishnu ba /
translated: Homage to all the world protectors!

original: a'i shva ra aa ma sta yaksha se n'a pa ta ye pra barba ra d'a ya /
analyzed: a'i shva ra aa ma sta yaksha se n'a pa ta ye pra barba ra d'a ya /
translated: Aśvāra, Amasthāyakṣasenāpati, Prabhāvatāya.

original: ma h'a satva ya aa na ni d'a n'a ya ma h'a dakshi ni ya ya sarba /
analyzed: ma h'a satva ya aa na ni d'a n'a ya ma h'a dakshi ni ya ya sarba /
translated: Mahāsattva, Aninditāya, Mahādakṣiṇīyasaṃ,

original: bo dhi satva n'am/🔽pra ba ra n'a pra ba ra /🔽yi mi tra barddha ya ba rishtha ya /
analyzed: bo dhi satva n'am/ pra ba ra n'a pra ba ra / yi mi tra barddha ya ba rishtha ya /
translated: Bodhisattvānāṃ,🔽Prabhāvanāpravara,

original: sarba satva na maskri ta /
analyzed: sarba satva na maskri ta /
translated: Amitravaradhayavardhayavṛṣṭhāya,

original: b'u dzi t'a ya ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: b'u dzi t'a ya ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtāvudhitāya,🔽Vujitāya, Mahāyakṣasenāpataye,

original: badzra se n'a ya ba ru /
analyzed: badzra se n'a ya ba ru /
translated: Vajrasenāyavaru,

original: be ru bu ru bu ru /
analyzed: be ru bu ru bu ru /
translated: Veru, Buru, Buru,

original: mu ru mu ru /
analyzed: mu ru mu ru /
translated: Muru, Muru,

original: tsu ru atsu ru /
analyzed: tsu ru atsu ru /
translated: Curu, Acuru,

original: du ru du ru /🔽hu ru hu ru ya /
analyzed: du ru du ru / hu ru hu ru ya /
translated: Duru, Duru,🔽Huru, Huru,

original: hu ru hu ru /
analyzed: hu ru hu ru /
translated: Huru, Huru,

original: @256a *// badzra se n'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: @256a *// badzra se n'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Vajrasenāya svāhā,

original: ma h'a se n'a ya sv'ah'a /🔽sarba k'a ma d'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ma h'a se n'a ya sv'ah'a / sarba k'a ma d'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Mahāsena svāhā,🔽Sarvakāmadāya svāhā,

original: sarba su kha d'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba su kha d'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Sarvasukhadāya svāhā,

original: sarba aartha s'a dha n'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba aartha s'a dha n'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Sarvārthasādhanāya svāhā,

original: sarba karma ka ma par pa ra d'a y'a sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba karma ka ma par pa ra d'a y'a sv'ah'a /
translated: Sarvakarmakamaparapardāya svāhā,

original: na mo badzra se n'a ya stu se n'a ya ma h'a se n'a ya /
analyzed: na mo badzra se n'a ya stu se n'a ya ma h'a se n'a ya /
translated: Namo vajrasenāya, stu senāya, mahāsena,

original: sarba k'a ma d'a ya /🔽sarba su kha d'a ya /
analyzed: sarba k'a ma d'a ya /🔽sarba su kha d'a ya /
translated: Sarvakāmadāya,🔽Sarvasukhadāya,

original: sarba aartha s'a dha n'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba aartha s'a dha n'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: sarva-artha-sadhana-aya svaha🔽sam-bho-shanti-tri-nada-dhaya-taya svaha

original: sam bho sha ti tri n'a dha ya ta ye sv'ah'a; bri go sha shum ne ga ra de ba d'a ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sam bho sha ti tri n'a dha ya ta ye sv'ah'a; bri go sha shum ne ga ra de ba d'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: brigo-shashu-mane-gara-deva-dada-aya svaha

original: r'a dzny'a ma karsha n'a ma karsha na ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: r'a dzny'a ma karsha n'a ma karsha na ya sv'ah'a /
translated: rajn-ama-karshana-ama-karshana-aya svaha

original: pra ti grihna na ma ma raksha /
analyzed: pra ti grihna na ma ma raksha /
translated: prati-grihnana mamaraksham🔽namaḥ sarva-karma-dhravara-da

original: na ma: sarba karma dhra ba ra da sarba k'a ma me pu ra ya /
analyzed: na ma: sarba karma dhra ba ra da sarba k'a ma me pu ra ya /
translated: sarva-kamame purya

original: da ha da ha /
analyzed: da ha da ha /
translated: dhadha

original: pa tsa pa tsa /
analyzed: pa tsa pa tsa /
translated: pacha-pacha

original: ai dam ma me k'a ryam s'a dha ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ai dam ma me k'a ryam s'a dha ya sv'ah'a /
translated: idam mama karyam sadhaya svaha

original: sa phyogs gtsang ma'am /
analyzed: sa phyogs gtsang ma'am /
translated: In a clean place,

original: bdag gi khyim du ras ma nyams pa la tshon rtsi spyin med pas rdo rje bri bar bya ste; gzhon nu'i gzugs 'chang ba gser gyi mdog can rgyan phreng dang / do shal dang / dpung rgyan dang / cod pan dang / rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa padma rtsa ba dmar po'i steng na 'dug ste lag pa g-yon pa na padma bsgreng ste 'dzin /
analyzed: bdag gi khyim du ras ma nyams pa la tshon rtsi spyin med pas rdo rje bri bar bya ste; gzhon nu'i gzugs 'chang ba gser gyi mdog can rgyan phreng dang / do shal dang / dpung rgyan dang / cod pan dang / rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa padma rtsa ba dmar po'i steng na 'dug ste lag pa g-yon pa na padma bsgreng ste 'dzin /
translated: or in one's own house, on an undamaged cloth, with undiminished colors, one should draw a vajra. The youthful form, golden-colored, adorned with various ornaments, garlands, necklaces, armlets, crowns, and jewelry, sitting on a red lotus root, holding an upright lotus in the left hand,

original: lag pa g-yas pa dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul du 'dug pa bri /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa dbugs 'byin pa'i tshul du 'dug pa bri /
translated: The right hand should be drawn in the manner of exhaling.

original: de'i steng du 'du byed thams cad ni /🔽mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'du byed thams cad ni / mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Above that, the following statements should be written:

original: 'du byed thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni /
translated: “All formations are impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //🔽chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o // chos thams cad ni /
translated: All formations are suffering.

original: bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are selfless.

original: mya ngan las @256b 'das pa ni /🔽zhi ba'o // zhes rtogs pa brjod pa rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las @256b 'das pa ni / zhi ba'o // zhes rtogs pa brjod pa rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is peace.”

original: de nas yar gyi ngo tshes gcig la brtsam zhing bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas yar gyi ngo tshes gcig la brtsam zhing bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Then, beginning on the first day of the waxing phase, one should commence the practice.

original: des de'i drung du dri thams cad kyis dkyil 'khor byugs la me tog dri zhim po dang / bdug pas mchod nas bstod pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des de'i drung du dri thams cad kyis dkyil 'khor byugs la me tog dri zhim po dang / bdug pas mchod nas bstod pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In front of it, one should anoint the maṇḍala with all fragrances, make offerings of fragrant flowers and incense, and offer praises.

original: mar gyi mar me gnyis kyang dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: mar gyi mar me gnyis kyang dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Two butter lamps should be offered:

original: gcig ni; sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: gcig ni; sangs rgyas la /
translated: one to the Buddha

original: gcig ni / gzhon nu la dbul lo //
analyzed: gcig ni / gzhon nu la dbul lo //
translated: and one to Mañjuśrī.

original: dus gsum du sbyin sreg sum cu rtsa gnyis bya zhing /
analyzed: dus gsum du sbyin sreg sum cu rtsa gnyis bya zhing /
translated: Three times a day, thirty-two burnt offerings should be made,

original: 'o ma dang bu ram sbyar ba dang / zho dang bu ram sbyar ba dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bu ram sbyar ba dang / zho dang bu ram sbyar ba dbul bar bya'o //
translated: and offerings of milk mixed with molasses and curd mixed with molasses should be made.

original: til zan dang 'byung po'i zas kyi gtor ma yang sbyin no //
analyzed: til zan dang 'byung po'i zas kyi gtor ma yang sbyin no //
translated: One should also offer sesame seeds and oblations to the bhūtas.

original: zas su 'o ma'am /
analyzed: zas su 'o ma'am /
translated: One should eat milk,

original: phye'i lde gu'am /
analyzed: phye'i lde gu'am /
translated: or a gruel of flour,

original: 'o ma rjen pa'i lde gu za zhing /
analyzed: 'o ma rjen pa'i lde gu za zhing /
translated: or a gruel of raw milk.

original: nas dang / yungs kar dang / shu ti dang / nye'u shing dang / shu dag dang / pri yang ku dang / lan tshva dang / til rnams cha bsnyams te btags pa'i phye mas sbyin sreg byas na; zhag bdun pa'i nyin par bsod nams chung ngu la yang lung nges par ston par byed do //
analyzed: nas dang / yungs kar dang / shu ti dang / nye'u shing dang / shu dag dang / pri yang ku dang / lan tshva dang / til rnams cha bsnyams te btags pa'i phye mas sbyin sreg byas na; zhag bdun pa'i nyin par bsod nams chung ngu la yang lung nges par ston par byed do //
translated: If one offers into the fire a homa of a compound of barley, mustard seeds, śigru, neem, priyaṅgu, asafoetida, and sesame seeds in equal parts, even one of little merit will receive a prophecy on the seventh day.

original: phyi de nyin par yang kha zas mi bza' zhing grangs nges pa med par bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: phyi de nyin par yang kha zas mi bza' zhing grangs nges pa med par bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: On the following day, one should not eat and recite the mantra an unspecified number of times.

original: bzlas brjod byas pas thams cad srung ba la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: bzlas brjod byas pas thams cad srung ba la sogs pa byed do //
translated: By reciting the mantra, one will accomplish all activities, such as protection.

original: cho ga gzhan yang mar gyi ngo zhag bcu bzhi la kha zas mi bza' bar byang @257a *//
analyzed: cho ga gzhan yang mar gyi ngo zhag bcu bzhi la kha zas mi bza' bar byang @257a *//
translated: Another rite: On the fourteenth day of the waning phase of the moon, one should fast and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: chub kyi shing drung du ba rog mo'i lcibs la ma lhung bas rdo rje'i gzugs byas te kha nub phyogs su bltas nas 'byung po'i gtor ma byas la /
analyzed: chub kyi shing drung du ba rog mo'i lcibs la ma lhung bas rdo rje'i gzugs byas te kha nub phyogs su bltas nas 'byung po'i gtor ma byas la /
translated: Having made a vajra form from the feathers of a black crow that has not fallen to the ground, facing west in front of the Bodhi tree, offer a bali to the bhūtas.

original: me tog dri zhim po phu te mar gyi mar me gnyis kyang mtshan mo sbar la /
analyzed: me tog dri zhim po phu te mar gyi mar me gnyis kyang mtshan mo sbar la /
translated: Having offered two lamps of ghee and fragrant flowers,

original: shar phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug nas thog mar shu ti dang / nye'u shing dang / yungs kar dang / nas rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i sbyin sreg lan gsum bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug nas thog mar shu ti dang / nye'u shing dang / yungs kar dang / nas rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i sbyin sreg lan gsum bya'o //
translated: sitting facing east, first perform three oblations of śṛṅgavera, neem, white mustard seed, and barley mixed with ghee.

original: de nas gu gul dang / bil ba dang / aa ga ru'i bdug pa rnams kyi sbyin sreg lan gsum bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gu gul dang / bil ba dang / aa ga ru'i bdug pa rnams kyi sbyin sreg lan gsum bya'o //
translated: Then perform three oblations of gugul, bilva, and agaru incense.

original: de nas lan sum cu rtsa gnyis byas te dngos grub kyi mtshan ma byung gi bar du k'a ra b'i ra dmar po'i me tog la lan re bzlas brjod byas pas mtshan rangs par snying gar bsnun na /
analyzed: de nas lan sum cu rtsa gnyis byas te dngos grub kyi mtshan ma byung gi bar du k'a ra b'i ra dmar po'i me tog la lan re bzlas brjod byas pas mtshan rangs par snying gar bsnun na /
translated: Then, having performed thirty-two [oblations], if the signs of siddhi arise, having recited [the mantra] once on a red karavīra flower, strike [the flower] on the heart all night.

original: nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will certainly be successful.

original: de nas mi'i gtso bo'am /
analyzed: de nas mi'i gtso bo'am /
translated: Then, the chief of men,

original: mi chen po dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: mi chen po dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to enthrall a great man,

original: nyin gcig bzhin du lan tshva las de'i gzugs byas /
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du lan tshva las de'i gzugs byas /
translated: one should make his image out of salt,

original: rkang pa g-yas pa nas brtsams la sbyin sreg lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa nas brtsams la sbyin sreg lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bya ste /
translated: and perform a homa of thirty-two oblations, beginning with his right foot.

original: thog mar ni /
analyzed: thog mar ni /
translated: First,

analyzed: shu ti dang / du ru ska mar dang sbyar bas lan gsum sbyin sreg bya'o //

analyzed: de nas gu gul mar dang sbyar ba'i bdug pas lan gsum bya'o //
translated: Then, one should perform three oblations with guggula incense mixed with ghee.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu sbyin sreg lan sum cu @257b rtsa gnyis byas na /

analyzed: zhag bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro // rdo rje sde ni blo ldan gyi //

analyzed: gsang sngags gnyis pa 'di dag ni // snga ma bzhin du bsdams byas na /

analyzed: las rnams thams cad byed par 'gyur //

analyzed: de skad sngar bshad sman rnams kyis // sbyin sreg sum cu rtsa gnyis byas //

analyzed: zla ba gcig tsam byas na ni //

analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad thob par 'gyur //

analyzed: dri dang me tog la sogs pas //

analyzed: lha dang lha min klu rnams dang // sems can kun kyang dbang du 'gyur //

analyzed: zhag bdun bar dus gsum du //

analyzed: rgyal po'i yid du 'ong ba dang / 'jigs pa kun las srung ba dang // skal ldan nor rnams 'phel bar byed //

analyzed: de bzhin me tog 'bras bu dang // dri dang bdug pa la sogs dang // zas dang skom la sogs pa rnams //

original: gang gi ming gis sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: gang gi ming gis sbyin sreg bya //

analyzed: des ni nor kun sbyin par byed //

original: sbyin byed de yi mdun dag tu //
analyzed: sbyin byed de yi mdun dag tu //

analyzed: sngar ni dran byas de bzhin byed //

analyzed: lha chen mtshan gyi steng du gzhag / kha zas 'dod pas kha zas dag /

analyzed: gang 'dod de ma thag tu 'thob //

analyzed: grong khyer nang du 'gro 'dod pas // bzlas brjod byas pa'i rdul dag gis //

analyzed: grong khyer sgrub pa 'grub 'gyur zhing // der ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi //

analyzed: yid du 'ong bar der 'gyur ro //

original: rtsod pa dang ni 'thab pa la //
analyzed: rtsod pa dang ni 'thab pa la //

translated: one will also win the argument.🔽If one desires to enthrall

analyzed: dbang du bya bar 'dod na ni //

original: rig sngags blon mo gtum mo ni //
analyzed: rig sngags blon mo gtum mo ni //

analyzed: zhag gcig smyung bya bzlas brjod bya //

original: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin sreg bya //
translated: One should meet with

analyzed: dbang du bya 'dod gang yin pa // de dag dang yang phrad par bya //
translated: those whom one wishes to enthrall.

original: @260a *// lan gcig zhag ni bdun gsum bya //
analyzed: @260a *// lan gcig zhag ni bdun gsum bya //

analyzed: skal chung la yang 'grub 'gyur te // gnod sbyin mi'am ci mo ma //
translated: even one of little fortune will be successful.🔽If one can enthrall yakṣiṇīs, kinnarīs,

analyzed: dri za mo yang dbang 'gyur na //
translated: and gandharvīs,

analyzed: gzhan dag lta ci zhig smos te //

analyzed: de yi cho ga bshad par bya //

analyzed: cho ga snga ma de nyid kyis //

analyzed: ming bcas me tog sbyin sreg bya //

original: de bzhin be kang ka ta'i shing //
analyzed: de bzhin be kang ka ta'i shing //

analyzed: brgya stong yang ni sbyin sreg byas // ci ste gzhal med khang mchog gam //
translated: one should offer one hundred and one oblations.🔽If one wishes for a celestial palace,

original: ci ste ri po mand'a ra'i //
analyzed: ci ste ri po mand'a ra'i //

original: steng na rig sngags rigs sngags rgyal //
analyzed: steng na rig sngags rigs sngags rgyal //

analyzed: byas na nges par dbang du 'gyur // aarka yi ni yam bsreg shing //

original: gzhig par bya ba'i dam pa yin //
analyzed: gzhig par bya ba'i dam pa yin //
translated: is the best for burning.

original: snu ha dang ni dri ldan kun //
analyzed: snu ha dang ni dri ldan kun //

analyzed: yam bsreg shing rnams sngar bshad pa //
translated: woods have been explained above.

analyzed: gzugs kyi drung du 'dug nas ni //

analyzed: de bzhin rgyun du sbyin sreg bya; ;gi'u wang gis ni lus byugs na //
translated: Anointing one’s body with guggulu,

original: lha rnams kyang ni dbang du 'gyur //
analyzed: lha rnams kyang ni dbang du 'gyur //
translated: even the gods will be brought under one’s power.

original: de bzhin gzugs kyi drung 'dug cing //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs kyi drung 'dug cing //
translated: Similarly, sitting in front of the image,

original: sbyin sreg rgyun du byas na ni //
analyzed: sbyin sreg rgyun du byas na ni //
translated: one should perform the homa continuously.🔽Anointing one’s eyes with excellent anjana,

original: lig bu mig ni dam pa yis; ;mig tu bskus na dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lig bu mig ni dam pa yis; ;mig tu bskus na dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: one will be loved.

original: gyad rnams brdabs pa'i mchog yin te //
analyzed: gyad rnams brdabs pa'i mchog yin te //

analyzed: bzlas brjod byas nas brgal na ni //
translated: will be defeated if one recites and challenges them.

original: gnam lcags brag la bab pa bzhin //
analyzed: gnam lcags brag la bab pa bzhin //

original: des ni gyad zla bcom par 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni gyad zla bcom par 'gyur //

original: gzugs brnyan rnyed par gdags pa 'am //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rnyed par gdags pa 'am //

analyzed: skud pa sngon po bzlas brjod byas //

analyzed: de bzhin tshod skud btags na ni //

analyzed: de yang rgyal byed @260b srung byed mchog /

analyzed: las rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa // ci yang rung ba gang dag dang // de dag kun ni thams cad la //
translated: one performs,

original: rnam pa thams cad byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad byed par 'gyur //

original: gtum po gzhal med khang gnas pa //🔽'di ni thams cad 'ching byed pa //
analyzed: gtum po gzhal med khang gnas pa // 'di ni thams cad 'ching byed pa //
translated: Canda dwelling in the celestial palace🔽binds everything.

original: bcings pa thams cad grol byed cing //
analyzed: bcings pa thams cad grol byed cing //
translated: He liberates all those bound

original: las kun byed de 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: las kun byed de 'grub pa yin //
translated: and accomplishes all activities.

original: gsang sngags 'di ni de yi grogs //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni de yi grogs //
translated: This mantra is his companion,

original: lag na rdo rje grogs mchog yin //🔽gdon dang gdon 'grol la sogs pa //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje grogs mchog yin // gdon dang gdon 'grol la sogs pa //
translated: and Vajrapāṇi is his supreme friend.

original: las rnams kun la mchod pa yin //
analyzed: las rnams kun la mchod pa yin //
translated: In all activities, such as exorcising and releasing grahas,🔽he is the one to be worshipped.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs dang chog ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs dang chog ni /
translated: The method of practice and the ritual

original: gser dang / dngul dang / zangs sna gsum las mdung rtse gsum pa byas la /
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / zangs sna gsum las mdung rtse gsum pa byas la /
translated: are as follows: One should make a trident from the three metals—gold, silver, and copper.

original: de'i dbus su rdo rje'i dbyibs byas nas sku gdung dang ldan pa'i mchod rten gyi drung ngam /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rdo rje'i dbyibs byas nas sku gdung dang ldan pa'i mchod rten gyi drung ngam /
translated: In the center of that, having made the shape of a vajra, in front of a stūpa containing relics,

original: khang pa'i nang du ri mo'i gzugs nub phyogs su kha bstan pa'i mdun du ba lang gi lci ba sa la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor skyang nul du byugs te /
analyzed: khang pa'i nang du ri mo'i gzugs nub phyogs su kha bstan pa'i mdun du ba lang gi lci ba sa la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor skyang nul du byugs te /
translated: In a house, in front of a painting of the form of the deity facing west, smear an unfallen cow pat on the ground as an unguent.

original: de'i steng du spos kyi skyang nul byas nas de'i ngos su yungs kar las mdung rtse gsum byas la /
analyzed: de'i steng du spos kyi skyang nul byas nas de'i ngos su yungs kar las mdung rtse gsum byas la /
translated: On top of that, having smeared incense, on its surface make a trident from white mustard seeds.

original: de'i steng du bzhag ste dus bzhag ste dus gsum du khrus byed cing dus gsum du mchod pa rgyas pa byas nas lan brgyad brgya bzlas brjod byas la de nyid du rtsva dur ba'i stan gyi steng du nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du bzhag ste dus bzhag ste dus gsum du khrus byed cing dus gsum du mchod pa rgyas pa byas nas lan brgyad brgya bzlas brjod byas la de nyid du rtsva dur ba'i stan gyi steng du nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Having placed it on top of that, having bathed at the three times, having performed extensive offerings at the three times, having recited it eight hundred times, one should sleep on top of a durva grass seat right there.

original: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi la zhag gcig gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas rang bzhin gyi @261a *//🔽tshul gyis ma 'ongs pa'i bar du bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi la zhag gcig gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas rang bzhin gyi @261a *// tshul gyis ma 'ongs pa'i bar du bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: On the waxing or waning night of the eighth or the fourteenth, having fasted for one day and night, endowed with the eight branches of the poṣadha, one should recite it naturally until dawn.

original: las thams cad byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las thams cad byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If one performs recitation, one will be able to perform all activities.

original: yid ldan ma ka ta ya na zhes bya ba'i las rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ldan ma ka ta ya na zhes bya ba'i las rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rites of the mind-born maiden Kātyāyanī will also be accomplished.🔽One should make a figurine of the potter’s clay, place it in a vessel, and offer into the fire one thousand and eight sticks of the banyan tree.

original: rdza mkhan gyi 'jim pa'i bur mas gzugs byas te snod du bcug la be kang ka ta'i yam bsreg shing brgyad stong gis rgyun ma chad par sbyin sreg byas nas de'i 'og tu yungs kar mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas rgyun ma chad par sbyin sreg byas
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi 'jim pa'i bur mas gzugs byas te snod du bcug la be kang ka ta'i yam bsreg shing brgyad stong gis rgyun ma chad par sbyin sreg byas nas de'i 'og tu yungs kar mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas rgyun ma chad par sbyin sreg byas
translated: Then, without interruption, one should offer mustard seeds smeared with ghee and honey.

original: na / gang gi ming nas smos te sbyin sreg byas pa de dbang du 'gyur te phrad par yang bya'o //
analyzed: na / gang gi ming nas smos te sbyin sreg byas pa de dbang du 'gyur te phrad par yang bya'o //
translated: Whoever’s name one utters while offering the oblations will become enthralled and will come under one’s power.

original: bya ba zin nas gzugs brnyan yang phyi rol du dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba zin nas gzugs brnyan yang phyi rol du dor bar bya'o //
translated: When the rite is completed, one should discard the figurine outside.🔽“If one wants to obtain food, one should recite the mantra eight hundred times over flowers and offer them to Mahādeva.

original: kha zas 'dod pas me tog brgyad brgya la bzlas brjod byas te lha chen po'i steng du phul na; kha zas ji lta bu 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas 'dod pas me tog brgyad brgya la bzlas brjod byas te lha chen po'i steng du phul na; kha zas ji lta bu 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain whatever kind of food one desires.

original: rdul la bsngags te sgo'i them pa la bsnun na /
analyzed: rdul la bsngags te sgo'i them pa la bsnun na /
translated: If one incants dust and strikes a door lintel with it,

original: grong khyer 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong khyer 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will obtain a town.

original: 'thab pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / rtsod pa thams cad la shags lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / rtsod pa thams cad la shags lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all disputes, debates, and arguments, one will prevail.

original: nang par langs te chu'i nang du lte ba tsam zhugs la lan brgyad stong bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: nang par langs te chu'i nang du lte ba tsam zhugs la lan brgyad stong bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Rising in the morning, one should enter water up to one’s navel and recite [the mantra] one thousand and eight times.

original: mi'i gtso bo'am mi chen po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i gtso bo'am mi chen po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the chief or a great man.

original: gzugs byas pa'i nang du rdo rje'i rig sngags bcug la de'i steng du be kang ka ta'i bud shing gis me sbar te ske tshe dang / @261b yungs kar dang / lan tshvas sbyin sreg byas na /
analyzed: gzugs byas pa'i nang du rdo rje'i rig sngags bcug la de'i steng du be kang ka ta'i bud shing gis me sbar te ske tshe dang / @261b yungs kar dang / lan tshvas sbyin sreg byas na /
translated: One should place the Vajravidāraṇa-vidyā inside an effigy, light a fire of cutch tree sticks above it, and offer oblations of black mustard seeds, white mustard seeds, and salt.

original: zhag bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In seven days, [the target] will be brought under one’s power.

original: gsang sngags 'di ni de yi grogs //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni de yi grogs //
translated: This mantra is his companion,

original: lag na rdo rje'i grogs mchog yin //🔽gdon dang gdon las dgrol la sogs //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i grogs mchog yin // gdon dang gdon las dgrol la sogs //
translated: The supreme friend of Vajrapāṇi.

original: kun la de ni mchod pa yin //
analyzed: kun la de ni mchod pa yin //
translated: For all, it is the worship🔽Of the one who liberates from grahas and enemies, and so forth.

original: gzhal med khang gnas kyi cho ga rdzogs so ////🔽na mo ratna tra ya sya /
analyzed: gzhal med khang gnas kyi cho ga rdzogs so //// na mo ratna tra ya sya /
translated: The ritual of the celestial palace is complete.🔽Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: na ma:sa mam t'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma:sa mam t'a n'am/
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: samyaksam buddha nam; na ma:aa pra ti ha ta ba la pa r'a kra ma yo ga gra he dz'a se ti ta sa ma ya satv'a ya sarba lo ka su dzi hv'a ya ma he shva ra su kh'a ya /
analyzed: samyaksam buddha nam; na ma:aa pra ti ha ta ba la pa r'a kra ma yo ga gra he dz'a se ti ta sa ma ya satv'a ya sarba lo ka su dzi hv'a ya ma he shva ra su kh'a ya /
translated: Namaḥ aparājitābala-pārakrama-yogagrahī-jāsati-tasmāyasatvāya sarvalokasujihvāya maheśvarasukhaya.

original: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye badzra p'a na ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye badzra p'a na ye /
translated: Mahāyakṣasenāpataye vajrapāṇaye.🔽Namo bṛhatīvajrasya.

original: na mo bridha badzra sya; na ma sthi ra badzra dha ra sya /
analyzed: na mo bridha badzra sya; na ma sthi ra badzra dha ra sya /
translated: Namaḥ sthiravajradhāriṇe.

original: sarba bo dhi satv'a ye /
analyzed: sarba bo dhi satv'a ye /
translated: Sarvabodhisatvāya.

original: bh'u ta ga na da ma ka sya /
analyzed: bh'u ta ga na da ma ka sya /
translated: Bhūtagaṇadāmakaśya.

original: ma h'a yaksha se na pa ta ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yaksha se na pa ta ye /
translated: Mahāyakṣasenāpataye.

original: badzra p'a ni ma h'a ksha y'a mi /
analyzed: badzra p'a ni ma h'a ksha y'a mi /
translated: Vajrapāṇi mahākṣayamī.

original: d'a ma y'a mi /
analyzed: d'a ma y'a mi /
translated: Dāmayī.

original: mo ha y'a mi /
analyzed: mo ha y'a mi /
translated: Mohayī.

original: be sha y'a mi /
analyzed: be sha y'a mi /
translated: Veśayī.

original: tvam ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ti da n+ya su badzra p'a na ye /
analyzed: tvam ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ti da n+ya su badzra p'a na ye /
translated: Tvam mahāyakṣasenāpati dānya subajrapāṇi.

original: yo hi me ya ha hi sa be to bhe ga ba to buddhe na ta th'a pra ti sa tya /
analyzed: yo hi me ya ha hi sa be to bhe ga ba to buddhe na ta th'a pra ti sa tya /
translated: Yo hi me yaha hi sabetato bhagavato buddhena tathāpratisatya.

original: ai dam na tsa te su badzra badzra murni sva le yya ya ti ma k'i lam ye y'a mi /
analyzed: ai dam na tsa te su badzra badzra murni sva le yya ya ti ma k'i lam ye y'a mi /
translated: Idam namastase subajra vajramūrṇi svālayāya yātyamī.🔽Tadyathā.

analyzed: tadya th'a / da ma dam /

analyzed: da ha da ha /
translated: Dhaha dhaha.

analyzed: narbba barbba dzarbba /

analyzed: marbba rabba aa ra li /

original: ma d'a li /
analyzed: ma d'a li /
translated: ma da li

original: khi r'i kh'i na /
analyzed: khi r'i kh'i na /
translated: The king said, Kīrti!🔽🔽

original: ha na ha na /
analyzed: ha na ha na /
translated: hana hana

original: da ma da ma /
analyzed: da ma da ma /
translated: dama dama

analyzed: sam mo ha ya aa mu kam me ba sha m'a ya sv'ah'a /
translated: samohāya amukam eva śamaya svāhā.

original: gsang sngags mchog 'di gtum pa ste //
analyzed: gsang sngags mchog 'di gtum pa ste //
translated: This supreme mantra is fierce,

analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i grogs su bshad //
translated: and is said to be Vajrapāṇi's companion.

original: dbyug 'dra stobs dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: dbyug 'dra stobs dang ldan pa ste //

translated: It is the delight of the great powerful ones,

analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin gyi grogs po yin //
translated: the friend of the vajra-holder.

original: las kun yang ni byed pa ste //
analyzed: las kun yang ni byed pa ste //
translated: It performs all actions,

original: zla ba phyed kyi bar du zas su 'o ma dang phye'i lde gu za zhing bsgrub par bya ste /

translated: He should practice for half a month, eating milk and flour gruel.

original: lag na rdo rje ri mo'i gzugs tshon rtsi sbyin med pas 'brir gzhug go /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje ri mo'i gzugs tshon rtsi sbyin med pas 'brir gzhug go /
translated: He should have Vajrapāṇi painted in a picture without using colors containing animal products.

original: ri mo'i gzugs kyi drung du ras ma nyams pa'i stan la gser dang / dngul dang / zangs sna gsum las byas pa'i rdo rje bzhag ste steng g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo'i gzugs kyi drung du ras ma nyams pa'i stan la gser dang / dngul dang / zangs sna gsum las byas pa'i rdo rje bzhag ste steng g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: In front of the picture, on a seat of undamaged cloth, he should place a vajra made of the three metals—gold, silver, and copper—and cover it.

original: pog dang sra rtsi pog sbyar ba yang dbul lo //🔽na ma:ku ru badzra p'a ni pra ti grihna hi mye dhu pa hu ti ma baspa hu ti ma ma ma tsa /
analyzed: pog dang sra rtsi pog sbyar ba yang dbul lo // na ma:ku ru badzra p'a ni pra ti grihna hi mye dhu pa hu ti ma baspa hu ti ma ma ma tsa /
translated: He should also offer incense and camphor.

original: raksha mam tvam sa ma yo bya dhi shu ti sv'ah'a /
analyzed: raksha mam tvam sa ma yo bya dhi shu ti sv'ah'a /
translated: namo kurubaja pānī prati gṛhṇa hima jyedhupahutimeva hutimeva mamatvam samacittaṃ vyādhiśānti siddham svāhā

original: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te dus gsum du bdug pa thogs shing lan brgyad brgya bzlas brjod byas nas phyi de nyin par mchod pa lhag par bskyed de bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te dus gsum du bdug pa thogs shing lan brgyad brgya bzlas brjod byas nas phyi de nyin par mchod pa lhag par bskyed de bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: The pure one, wearing clean clothes, should offer incense three times, recite [the mantra] eight hundred times, and the next day, increasing the offerings, he should recite [the mantra].

original: mar me yang ci 'byor pas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: mar me yang ci 'byor pas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should also light as many butter lamps as one can afford.

original: de nas lag na rdo rje 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi will come and

original: bya ba gang yin pa de byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba gang yin pa de byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will do whatever needs to be done.

original: grub nas kyang zla ba phyed kyi bar du cho ga bsrung bar bya'o //🔽dam tshig ma mthong bas byas na ma rungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub nas kyang zla ba phyed kyi bar du cho ga bsrung bar bya'o // dam tshig ma mthong bas byas na ma rungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even after one has become accomplished, one should maintain the ritual for half a month.

original: slob dpon @265a *//
analyzed: slob dpon @265a *//
translated: If one does it without having seen the commitments, it will be disastrous.🔽One should serve and worship the master

original: la gus pa dang mchod pa byas nas gdod cho ga rgyas par mnod par bya ste /
analyzed: la gus pa dang mchod pa byas nas gdod cho ga rgyas par mnod par bya ste /
translated: and then take up the extensive ritual.

original: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su karsha pa na brgyad kyi 'gron bus rdo rje byas nas slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su karsha pa na brgyad kyi 'gron bus rdo rje byas nas slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of the vajra maṇḍala, one should make a vajra with eight kārṣapaṇas and offer it to the master.

original: de lta bus cho ga rgyas pa bsgrubs na gdod 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bus cho ga rgyas pa bsgrubs na gdod 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accomplishes the extensive ritual in this way, one will become accomplished.

original: rig sngags thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the vidyā-mantras will be accomplished.

original: slob dpon ma yin zhing bu ma yin pa bsten nas lo gcig ma lon pa la sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ma yin zhing bu ma yin pa bsten nas lo gcig ma lon pa la sbyin par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not give it to someone who is not a master or a disciple, or to someone who has not served for a year.

original: yang na slob dpon gyis rab tu sbyang ba byas nas gzod gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na slob dpon gyis rab tu sbyang ba byas nas gzod gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the master should perform the purification and then take it.

translated: Then, the assembly of messengers,

analyzed: yid las skyes pa drug cu bzhi //

analyzed: bstan pa rnams ni bshad par bya //

analyzed: na mo ma ti hi badzra p'a ni badzra p'a ni ma h'a yaksha se na pa ti r'a dznyo pa ya ti sv'ah'a /
